results.title: Sleep my love
results.creator_credit: Douglas Sirk, Ralph Cohn, Charles Rogers, Mary Pickford and Triangle Productions
results.brief_description: In this noir mystery thriller, a wealthy heiress (Claudette Colbert) wakes up hysterical on board a train from New York to Boston with no idea how she got there. When she contacts her husband (Don Ameche), he informs her that she disappeared after threatening him with a gun. On her return he urges her to visit an eminent psychiatrist. Soon it becomes clear that her apparently loving husband is in fact plotting to drive her to insanity then kill her and collect her fortune. Though dismissed by Sirk himself, this is a tautly paced thriller, with Joseph Valentine’s expressionist photography giving rise to a suitably nightmarish evocation of insanity and shifting appearances. Cast also includes Robert Cummings, Rita Johnson and George Coulouris.

results.title: The End of the day = La Fin du jour
results.creator_credit: Julien Duvivier, Regina Film and Filmsonar a Epinay
results.brief_description: This comedy focuses on the lives and relationships between elderly thespians living in an actors’ retirement home. The home is almost bankrupt and so the actors must support themselves. The residents include a faded sex symbol, an intellectual actor who kept a great distance between himself and the audience, and a depressed thespian who tries to conceal the fact that he was only an understudy. Cast includes Louis Jouvet, Michel Simon, Madeleine Ozeray and Victor Francen. In French.

results.title: The Human beast = La Bete humaine
results.creator_credit: Jean Renoir and Paris Film Productions
results.brief_description: Although Renoir was a pioneer of location shooting and the use of non-professionals in feature films, his films resist easy classification. “La Bete Humaine” is no exception. Relocated in the 1930s, Renoir invests Zola’s story of a man apparently driven by forces outside his control with both careful observation of the working class milieu and a passionate and lyrical poetry which goes beyond Zola’s naturalism. Inspired by the novel by Emile Zola. Cast includes Jean Gabin and Simone Simon. In French with no subtitles.

results.title: The Lacemaker = La Dentelliere
results.creator_credit: Claude Goretta, Yves Gasser, Yves Peyrot, Citel Films, Filmproduktion Janus and Action Films
results.brief_description: Pomme works as a hairdresser and lives with her protective mother in Paris. She goes on a holiday to the seaside town of Cabourg with a more worldly friend. There she forms a relationship with Francois, a young student, and they decide to live together in Paris. Social differences soon emerge. While Francois is garrulously intellectual, Pomme is reserved, incapable of communicating with Francois and his friends but maintaining a mysterious inner radiance. Goretta has described his film as “a genre painting” in narrative form and it is constructed in a series of brief fragmentary scenes which form a picture without evident narrative connections. With its narrative ellipses - eloquent silences and observation of Pomme’s mysterious inner life - Goretta’s film resembles Bresson’s “Une Femme Douce”. Cast includes Isabelle Huppert, Yves Benneyton, Florence Giorgetti, and Anne-Marie Duringer. Based on the novel by Pascal Laine. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Devil's eye = Djavulens oga
results.brief_description: The devil sends Don Juan back to earth to deflower Virtue (Bibi Andersson), the daughter of a naive country parson. She finds his advances amusing rather than irresistible. Bergman playfully contrasts the elaborately staged scenes of Hell with the reality of the pastor’s household, producing a film with a comic tone that is absent from his previous work. Cast also includes Jurl Kulle, Stig Jarrell and Gunnar Bjornstrand. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: Snake eyes
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma, Touchstone and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Set against the backdrop of a high profile boxing match, gaudy casino and an immanent hurricane, this essentially interior crime thriller centres around 2 friends and law enforcement agents, one of whom may or may not be corrupt. Detective Ray Santoro (Nicolas Cage) is an Atlantic City cop, willing to take a bribe, dreaming of being on television, and always getting results. He meets his long time friend, Navy Commander Kevin Dunne (Gary Sinise), ringside, at a heavyweight bought signalling the swan song of the Atlantic City arena, where they, along with thousands of spectators witness the political assassination of the U.S Secretary of Defence. The stadium is shut down as Santoro leads the investigation, searching for a mysterious woman (Carla Gugion) seen speaking to the secretary shortly before he was killed. Dunne, meanwhile, is taking credit for locating the shooter, a Palestinian fall guy. As Santoro finds his witness, he learns of a conspiracy involving the Norfolk testing and learns the shocking truth about his friend. With state of the art surveillance equipment in the stadium, all eyes are watching proceeding and nothing can escape detection. When the truth is finally revealed, Santoro is forced to question his loyalty to Dunne, and whether he will live up to his reputation as a corrupt cop. Cast also includes John Heard, Stan Shaw and Michael Rispoli.

results.title: No skin off my ass (E)
results.creator_credit: Bruce LaBruce, Jurgen Bruning and Gaytown Films
results.brief_description: One of the first important works of the “New Queer Cinema”, this acerbic and very witty black comedy is a bout a gay hairdresser (LaBruce) who falls in love with a young skinhead. The skinhead, unsure of how he feels about the hairdresser’s attentions seeks advice from his sister but she is a lesbian separatist filmmaker and not much interested in what goes on between men. Gleefully upsetting the expectations of both the heterosexual and homosexual mainstreams, “No Skin off my Ass” is a film that mixes up gender, sex roles and ideology. LaBruce is uninterested in “positive” images of gay men. Instead he wants to celebrate the absurd irrationalities of desire.

results.title: Manhattan [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Charles H. Joffe, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and United Artists
results.brief_description: Manhattan is both a very funny and perceptive comedy of manners about educated sophisticated New Yorkers as well as one of the most loving homages to the “Big Apple” ever filmed. Woody Allen plays Isaac Davis, a comedy writer whose wife (Meryl Streep) has left him for another woman. Isaac is intending to write a book about his romantic entanglements but his work is constantly interrupted by the demands of two ex-wives, his guilt over his relationship with a precocious 17 year old schoolgirl (Mariel Hemingway) and his affair with his best-friend’s mistress (Diane Keaton). Managing to be biting and romantic, elegant and satirically funny, “Manhattan” defined the social mores of the educated urban bourgeoisie at the tail end of the “Me Generation”. Filmed in luscious black and white by Gordon Willis and featuring some of George Gershwin’s finest music, “Manhattan” is a celebration of the vitality and sheer magic of the city of New York. Though this bittersweet fable may poke fun at the pretentiousness and self-righteousness of New Yorkers, Allen’s teasing of people’s foibles never reverts to mere caricature. This version features the film’s original theatrical trailer.

results.title: Tender loving care
results.creator_credit: David Wheeler, Rob Landeros and Aftermath Media
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Andrew Neiderman and directed by David Wheeler, “Tender loving care” is an interactive movie where the viewer’s involvement can alter the outcome. The story revolves around the Overton couple who are suffering the trauma of a personal tragedy. When a psychiatric nurse comes to their aid, all sorts of mysteries and secrets begin to unfold. In between scenes the view is given thematic apperception tests about the characters and also personal views and interpretations. Clues are also discovered by navigating through the 3D environments or certain parts in the film. Guided by Doctor Turner (John Hurt), your journey through “Tender Loving Care” is a psychological experience that changes each time you play. Cast includes Michael Esposito, Beth Tegarden and Marie Caldare.

results.title: Erin Brockovich [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Steven Soderbergh, Stacey Sher, Michael Shamberg, Danny DeVito, Jersey Films and Columbia Picture
results.brief_description: Erin Brockovich (Julia Roberts) is a single mother raising three young children. Failing to win a law suit following an automobile accident, she begins work as a secretary for lawyer Ed Masry where she stumbles over a small case against Pacific Gas and Electric. Further investigation reveals the company is responsible for contaminating the town’s water supply and contributing to the illnesses of a number of families. With Ed’s help, Erin files a law suit on behalf of the families involved. Based on a true story.
